editor:
# Set language to English

detectable = { "name": "one",
        "url": "http://reeborg.ca/src/images/1.png",
        "detectable": True,
        "message": "Allowed to step on 1.",
        "info": "safe"
        }
detectable_fatal = { "name": "two",
        "url": "http://reeborg.ca/src/images/2.png",
        "detectable": True,
        "fatal": True,
        "message": "Not allowed to step on 2."
         }
fatal = { "name": "three",
        "url": "http://reeborg.ca/src/images/3.png",
        "fatal": True,
        "message": "Not allowed to step on 3."
        }


RUR.add_tile_type(detectable)
RUR.add_tile_type(detectable_fatal)
RUR.add_tile_type(fatal)

RUR.set_tile_at_position("one", 4, 1)
RUR.set_tile_at_position("two", 7, 1)
RUR.set_tile_at_position("three", 6, 4)


RUR.set_tile_at_position("red", 1, 8)
'''The way the highlighting works, each line
visible in the editor is scanned for comments 
preceded by a # which are then ignored.
Doing so on the following line gives a syntax error.
For this reason, highlighting is automatically turned off.

If such a line of code appears in the "pre" editor,
it does not cause any such problem.
'''

RUR.set_tile_at_position("#00ff00", 3, 8)
RUR.set_tile_at_position("rgb(0, 0, 0)", 5, 8)
RUR.set_tile_at_position("rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1)", 7, 8)


while front_is_clear():
    move()

turn_left()

while front_is_clear():
    move()
